result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Dacquisto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work or any other reason the Sheriff will allow are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. May serve on home monitor after serving 100 days. - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay fine, costs, and DNA surcharge on each count. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,595.88, joint and several with co-defendant Matt Rudolph, to Fleet Farm.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent.

timeConds.notes: Perform 80 hours of community service, perferrably with the Portage County Parks Department.

records.addlTxt: Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant may be issued.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony J Dacquisto in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:41 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement. Defendant is pleading to all counts.
State makes recommends.

Restitution sheet is filed.
State has complied with victim notificaiton statutes.

Atty Halverson concurs.
Defendant concurs. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

State reflects that all counts are amended to a maximum penalty for not more than two years.
Court indicates on the complaint that the maximum term is not more than two years on each of the five counts.

Parties discuss the length of probation. 

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 4
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 5

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Atty Halverson states that her client falls under repeater status.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Issue of worthless check
Count 2: Issue of worthless check
Count 3: Issue of worthless check
Count 4: Issue of worthless check
Count 5: Issue of worthless check

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court believes plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 40 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve on home monitor after serving 100 days
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $200 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Perform 80 hours of community service, perferrably with the Portage County Parks Department
Maintain absolute sobriety
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,595.88, joint and several with co-defendant Matt Rudolph, to Fleet Farm
Maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 40 Days, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 1
Huber granted for work and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve on home monitor after serving 100 days
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 40 Days, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 1 and Count 2
Huber granted for work and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve on home monitor after serving 100 days
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Jail sentence of 40 Days, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Huber granted for work and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve on home monitor after serving 100 days
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 5:
Jail sentence of 40 Days, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3 and Count 4
Huber granted for work and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
May serve on home monitor after serving 100 days
Probation for a period of 36 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3 and Count 4
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3 and Count 4
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J Dacquisto
Current: 1022 South 9th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2015)
Prior: 500 Forest Street, Wausau, WI 54403

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Fleet Farm Stevens Point.
Defendant is not to write new checks nor open any new checking accounts while this case is pending.

Attorney Acalia Halverson in court, defendant Anthony J Dacquisto not in court, in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:11pm. Court calls case and states appearances.
Atty Constable makes arguments.
Court questions Atty Halverson on what pleas does the defendant wish to enter on all counts.
Defendant enters NOT GUILTY pleas on all counts.

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY pleas are entered on all counts.

Body Only.
sent to JR 4/13/15 ks

Defendant Anthony J Dacquisto not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause. Criminal warrant.
